div.p: This case-insensitive code system http://tecnomod-um.org/CodeSystem/stroke-proc-not-done-reason-cs defines the following codes:

tr.td: Patient presented or evaluated outside the established time limit for the procedure.
An eligible large vessel occlusion for thrombectomy was not identified.
A medical contraindication to the procedure existed (e.g., bleeding risk).
The patient or their legal representative refused the procedure.
The patient was transferred to another hospital for the procedure.
The procedure was not available at the facility (e.g., lack of equipment, staff).
Patient's baseline disability made benefit from the procedure unlikely.
Patient's neurological deficit was too mild to warrant the procedure.
The procedure had already been performed at another facility prior to arrival/transfer.
Financial or coverage reasons prevented the procedure.
The reason was not documented or is unknown.
Informed consent for the procedure was not obtained.
Only mechanical thrombectomy was considered, and thrombolysis was not performed.
The procedure could not be performed due to technical or anatomical challenges.
Angiography to assess the situation was not performed.

title.value: Stroke Procedure Not Done Reason Code System

description.value: Codes specifying the reason principal for not performing a key stroke procedure (Thrombolysis, Thrombectomy).

definition.value: Patient presented or evaluated outside the established time limit for the procedure.
An eligible large vessel occlusion for thrombectomy was not identified.
A medical contraindication to the procedure existed (e.g., bleeding risk).
The patient or their legal representative refused the procedure.
The patient was transferred to another hospital for the procedure.
The procedure was not available at the facility (e.g., lack of equipment, staff).
Patient's baseline disability made benefit from the procedure unlikely.
Patient's neurological deficit was too mild to warrant the procedure.
The procedure had already been performed at another facility prior to arrival/transfer.
Financial or coverage reasons prevented the procedure.
The reason was not documented or is unknown.
Informed consent for the procedure was not obtained.
Only mechanical thrombectomy was considered, and thrombolysis was not performed.
The procedure could not be performed due to technical or anatomical challenges.
Angiography to assess the situation was not performed.
